salaam.definition: A low bow as a ceremonial act of deference.

shamba.definition: An area of cultivated ground; a plot of land, a small subsistence farm for growing crops and fruit-bearing trees, often including the dwelling of the farmer.

djembe.definition: A large, skin-covered drum played with the hands, used in West African - and some fusion music.

panga.definition: Any of various edible freshwater fish of the genus Pangasius, native to southeast Asia, especially the iridescent shark, Pangasius hypophthalmus.

safari.definition: A trip into any undeveloped area to see, photograph or hunt wild animals in their own environment.

naam.definition: The act or process of taking property for the purpose of compensation.

boubou.definition: A flowing wide-sleeved robe worn by men in much of West Africa, and to a lesser extent in North Africa.

askari.definition: A member of a local African military or police unit serving in a European force

rasta.definition: belonging to an originally Jamaican sect regarding Blacks as chosen people, and the Jamaican national colors and the leaf of the marijuana plant as symbols

kabaka.definition: The title of the king of Buganda.
